A family friend of mine has a similar experience. He has a green card and has lived in the US for 20 years. His wife is American, his kids are American. The family went to the US Virgin Islands for vacation, and on the way back he was detained in Miami for having a green card. Then he was sent to Peurto Rico to be held for a few days. Then he was flown back to Miami. Then he was given a choice of being sent to jail to await his court date, or be flown to Canada.

posts.title: China strikes back with 125% tariffs on U.S. goods, starting April 12
top_comments:
> “Even if the U.S. continues to impose higher tariffs, it will no longer make economic sense and will become a joke in the history of world economy,” the statement said, according to a CNBC translation.


That statement is going to cause a major tantrum in the administration.

>“With tariff rates at the current level, there is no longer a market for U.S. goods imported into China,” the statement noted, adding that “if the U.S. government continues to increase tariffs on China, Beijing will ignore.”

They preemptively boxed Trump into a corner, lol.

It doesn't even matter what the tariff % raises to, they're already high enough that trade has ceased. They're always going to stay just lower than the US tariffs to make clear they are not the aggressor here. But Trump will keep raising them as long as he doesn't have the last word. Someone needs to call his bluff, and I'm glad China has the balls and poker hand to do it. It's not even a matter of who blinks first, because it's 100% going to be Trump, it's just a matter of how much damage he does for how long.

Well, congratulations are in order, US.


You made China, South Korea and Japan sit at the table and start to negotiate a trade deal between them.


Not bad. 😁🫢

It's an effective trade halt between China and the US. 

In 2024, the US exported $143.5 billion in goods to China and imported $438 billion from China.

Recession is basically guaranteed at this point. We'll be lucky if it's not a depression.

> This served “a radical green agenda that made life worse for Americans”, the White House said, as Trump criticised the “ridiculous” amount of time he says it takes to wet his hair in the shower.

Oh c’mon, assuming he’s referring to the hair on his head, he has like…11 strands at most there, all hanging on for dear life. The aerosolized mist from a flushing toilet could render that wisp of straw sopping wet.

posts.title: Oklahoma woman stole $1.5 million from elderly women in romance scams, officials say
top_comments: The most depressing part is the scammer seems to maybe have just been sending the money they made to yet another scammer.

As someone who is getting older, though not elderly (yet), I think about this stuff. There is an army of people who make their living taking advantage of the elderly. I cringe at the stories my mother tells me about scam services she has purchased. People are constantly coming to her door to pressure her to let them do something to her house.

And that is just in person. Don't get me started with online stuff she does. I told her if there is ANY doubt, assume it is a scam. Or check with one of us 'kids' first. Companies like Amazon and Microsoft don't give a shit about you and will not proactively contact you about any problem. And anytime you hear 'gift card', it is automatically a scam. Why would one of your friends want you to purchase a dozen gift cards, reveal the codes, take a picture and send it to them? It makes no sense. She was about 10 minutes away from doing it before her friend called her to say her email account was hacked.

* calling herself "Edward Lotts" and saying the money was needed to pay off a debt that would allow "Lotts" to receive a $2 million payment... the victim sold her paid-off home to send Echohawk $600,000.
* "Jason Morris," ...needed money to buy supplies and fuel for an oil tanker in Turkey, the affidavit said. That victim allegedly sent over $100,000 in Apple gift cards, cash and money wires. 
* "Glenn Goddard" ...had known each other since college... The victim was convinced to pay $250,000 "for expenses related to a financial portfolio he was sending her from Syria," ... The funds were sent via gift cards, cash and a cashier's check. 
* "Jason Morris" ...told the victim that the money would pay for an alleged oil vessel in Alaska that needed fuel to return to shore ...they could move in together once the payment was received and the ship was docked. That victim sent $40,000 in Apple gift cards and $170,000 in two wire transfers.

A family friend of mine has a similar experience. He has a green card and has lived in the US for 20 years. His wife is American, his kids are American. Then he was flown back to Miami. Then he was given a choice of being sent to jail to await his court date, or be flown to Canada.
The USA has a *lot* of cool shit that I will now probably never get to see.
Way to lose friends and isolate  people.

posts.title: Fast fashion items overwhelm Sweden’s recycling centres
top_comments: We need to rethink our continued purchase of utter junk from SHEIN to Temu, and of course Sweden’s great gift to the world H&M - which was a main starter of this trend

> Swedes throw away 90,000 tonnes of textiles per year, or 10kg per person, according to the Swedish Society for the Conservation of Nature.

> The EU average is 19kg

I'm maybe at 1Kg max, considering year where I don't even throw any clothes are common, I'm not even sure it's worth for me to talk in year. 

WTF is wrong with people.
Pretty much every time I walked pass clothing shops and just wondering who the fuck is buying all these clothes.

Fast fashion should be banned.  Producing clothes is agriculturally intensive, industrially intensive, and labour intensive.  

Clothes should be made to last.  Fashion should not be something so ugly it has to be changed every 6 months.
Ban fashion dictators

> 2,500 litres of water and one kilogramme of chemicals are needed to make a T-shirt that weighs 135 grammes

Fuck me, humans are a cancer on Planet Earth.

I don't even want to think about how much resources was just wasted by me submitting this comment.
Nobody needs fast fashion. Let's stop wasting precious resources on bullshit.

I worked at H&M for a while, half of the stuff I saw coming in had button with one stitch keeping them on. I bought clothing there with my employee discount pretty often, my pants buttons always needed the button re-sewn after about a week or two. 

I don’t know why anyone bought it. The employee discount made sense for me, but I never bought there again after I left (no bad blood with the company either, their product just sucks)

They got great benefits though

So, what is "Fast Fashion"? I have heard the term and understand its trendy clothing produced in mass quantities and then generally doesn't get purchased so its just destroyed, but what is an example?
